text: Pyrausta demantrialis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Herbert Druce in 1895. It is found in the United States, where it has been recorded from Arizona, Florida, Indiana, Michigan, New Mexico, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, Texas and West Virginia. It has also been recorded from Mexico (Guerrero), Ecuador (Loja Province) and Venezuela. Adults have been recorded on wing from June to November in the United States. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1895 demantrialis Category:Moths of North America Category:Moths of South America
title: Pyrausta demantrialis
